data.title: Hearst Corporation - Remote Work From Home Jobs & Careers
data.meta_description: Find remote work from home jobs and careers with Hearst Corporation. Get a better remote job search with FlexJobs today!
data.text:
In business since 1887, the Hearst Corporation got its start when founder William Randolph Hearst purchased the San Francisco Examiner newspaper near the end of the 19th century. Now one of the largest diversified media, information, and technology services companies in the world, the Hearst Corporation is comprised of cable television networks and TV stations, global ratings agencies, medical information and services businesses, newspapers, magazines, digital services businesses, radio broadcasting companies, real estate agencies, business information services, and investment firms. As an employer, the Hearst Corporation offers career opportunities across the United States that are as wide-ranging and diverse as its portfolio, with opportunities in editing, news & journalism, marketing, entertainment & media, and operations, to name a few. In the past, the Hearst Corporation has offered flexible work in the form of part-time, freelance, temporary, and hybrid to 100% remote jobs, sometimes featuring alternative and/or flexible schedules as well.

Headquartered in New York, New York, the Hearst Corporation is comprised of more than 360 businesses. The company operates 30 television stations, such as Boston, Massachusetts's WCVB-TV and Sacramento, California's KCRA-TV, which collectively reach 19% of U.S. viewers. Hearst's esteemed newspapers span the country and include the San Francisco Chronicle, Stamford Advocate, Houston Chronicle, Midland Daily News, and The Telegraph, among others. Furthermore, the company publishes over 300 magazines, such as Cosmopolitan, Esquire, Good Housekeeping, Country Living, Food Network, HGTV, and O magazines.
